segments.text: I can't believe how much water is on the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's just spreading out, ruining everything it touches.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and the floor is turning into a slippery mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a slow-motion disaster unfold before my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying that plate, oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for her to notice the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are too busy with their cookies to see the danger they're in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a mess, and it's only going to get worse if no one does anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet soon, before the whole kitchen is flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just gross, all that water spreading out and making everything wet and slimy.
segments.speaker: PAR
